content.question: Part B The functions <math alttext="j"> <mi>j</mi> </math> and <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals ln open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses minus ln 5 plus 3 ln x"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>ln</mi><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>ln</mi><mi>x</mi></math> <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses fraction numerator sin x over denominator cos x end fraction plus fraction numerator cos x over denominator sin x end fraction close parentheses cos x"> <mi>k</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfenced> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </math>. (i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single natural logarithm without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="ln open parentheses expression close parentheses"><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>. (ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as an expression in which <math alttext="sin x"><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></math> appears once and no other trigonometric functions are involved.

frqParts.text: Part B The functions <math alttext="j"> <mi>j</mi> </math> and <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals ln open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses minus ln 5 plus 3 ln x"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mi>ln</mi><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>ln</mi><mi>x</mi></math> <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses fraction numerator sin x over denominator cos x end fraction plus fraction numerator cos x over denominator sin x end fraction close parentheses cos x"> <mi>k</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfenced> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </math>. (i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single natural logarithm without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="ln open parentheses expression close parentheses"><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>. (ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as an expression in which <math alttext="sin x"><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></math> appears once and no other trigonometric functions are involved.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
